message.content:
Reinforcement Learning, Theory. 

Reinforcement learning is the main focus of the paper, as it deals with learning in Markov decision processes with undiscounted rewards. The paper analyzes the learning curve for this type of problem and explores methods for estimating the expected return per unit time. 

Theory is also a relevant sub-category, as the paper uses methods from statistical mechanics to calculate lower bounds on the agent's performance in the thermodynamic limit. The paper provides a theoretical analysis of the problem and derives lower bounds on the return of policies based on imperfect statistics.
